sourceMeaningMnemonic: A <radical>bamboo</radical> thing you put on your head to <radical>stand</radical> taller would probably be a hat. A bamboo hat is probably one of those hats you think of when you think of rice farmers, a <kanji>conical hat</kanji>.
meaningInfo: You know the ones I'm talking about? They're cone-shaped, sort of, and they go on your head, keeping the sun off your face.
readingMnemonic: A <kanji>conical hat</kanji> is kind of like an umbrella on your head. What's the reading for "umbrella" in Japanese? Why, it's <reading>kasa</reading> (<ja>かさ</ja>)!
readingInfo: Think about a bamboo umbrella on your head. They're pretty similar in shape, after all.
